member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddFileOptions
member.summary: The options that control the behavior when adding a file to a project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddFileOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Instantiates a new instance of the AddFileOptions class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddFileOptions.AdditionalReplacementValues
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of key/value pairs that will be used to replace tokens in the file. These values are additional to the values in TokenReplacementValues. In the case of conflicts, the values specified in AdditionalReplacementValues will override the TokenReplacementValues.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddFileOptions.SuppressOverwritePrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to suppress prompting the end user if an existing file is detected and should be overwritten. The default is false

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddFileOptions.OpenOnComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the file should be opened after being added. The default is false

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddServiceInstanceResult

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddServiceInstanceResult.#ctor(System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique name of the folder where the service artifacts are stored.
The Uri that will be launched to show the "Getting Started" documentation to the user, or null if one isn't available.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddServiceInstanceResult.FolderName
member.summary: Gets the unique name of the folder where the service artifacts are stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddServiceInstanceResult.GettingStartedDocument
member.summary: Gets or sets the "Getting Started" documentation information.
member.remarks: The "Getting Started" document will be launched when configuration completes, and will be listed within the Service folder for viewing the documentation at a later point. Leave null if you want to opt out of the built-in "Getting Started" functionality.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceCustomUIConfigurator

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceCustomUIConfigurator.ShowCustomUI
member.summary: Displays custom UI to configure new provider that needs some special UI, which is not supported by default ConnectedServices flow.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid
member.summary: A ConnectedServiceProvider service that shows a grid of instances, where a single instance can be chosen to add to the current project.
member.remarks: For any string property you can return null to use the default text. In order to not display text, return string.Empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display under the title of the dialog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.GridHeaderText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display directly above the grid.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.EnumeratingServiceInstancesText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display while Connected Services is attempting to retrieve the service instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.NoServiceInstancesText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display when no instances are available because the enumeration returned no instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ServiceInstanceNameLabelText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display as the column header or label for the service instance name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ColumnMetadata
member.summary: Gets the keys and display strings for metadata to show as columns in the service instance list.

remarks.para: The Item1 field in the enumerable's Tuple is used as a key into the dictionary. The Item2 field is a localized display string to use as the column header.
The columns will be added in the order given after the column that shows the service instance's name. To change the display text for the service instance name, use the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.DetailMetadata
member.summary: Gets the keys and display strings for metadata to show in the property pane (to the right) when an instance is selected from the service instance list.

remarks.para: The Item1 field in the enumerable's Tuple is used as a key into the dictionary. The Item2 field is a localized display string to use as the field label.
The labels and fields will be displayed in the order given after the label and value for the service instance's name. To change the display text for the service instance name, use the property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.EnumerateServiceInstancesAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get a list of all of the service instances for the currently authenticated user, if any.
member.param: CancellationToken used to cancel the enumeration operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task that provides the available service instances.

remarks.para: This method is guaranteed to not be called from the UI thread. It will only be called on providers that return 'true' from if a ConnectedServiceAuthenticator is implemented.

The implementation's Task should complete only once the service instance Enumerable is fully available. The Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the returned Task completes, and the enumeration should not block on any network calls.

Because this is not called on the UI thread, the implementation should not show any errors. If need be, the Task should complete in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) and the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CreateAuthenticatorAsync
member.summary: Creates the ConnectedServiceAuthenticator that allows users to log into the service.
member.returns: The ConnectedServiceAuthenticator instance, or null if the provider doesn't need to use authentication.
member.remarks: The Connected Services core will call Dispose() on this instance when the dialog is closed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CanConfigureService
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this service can be configured through the connected service provider.

remarks.para: Not all connected service providers will allow configuration (or not without authentication, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ConfigureServiceText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use as the text of the control for the users to configure the service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ConfigureServiceAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Configure a service either through a dialog or linking to the configure web page.
member.param: CancellationToken used to cancel the configuration operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task for the configuration.

remarks.para: This method is guaranteed to be called from the UI thread.

If an implementation desires to present blocking/modal UI, it may do so. If the service is configured synchronously before the method returns, the returned Task should be marked as completed (for example, via Task.FromResult()).

If the implementation runs in the background, it may return an in-progress Task, and the Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the Task completes. In this case, the Connected Services code may cancel the task via the CancellationToken if the user closes the Conencted Services UI before the service has been configured.

If the implementation shows/handles any errors, the Task should not fault on them, nor throw them as Exceptions. If the returned Task completes in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CanCreateServiceInstance
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the provider can currently create a service instance.
member.remarks: Not all connected service providers will allow creation (or not without authentication, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CreateServiceInstanceText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use as the text of the control for the users to create a new instance.

remarks.para: Not all connected service providers will allow creation (or not without authentication, etc.) Providers may return null if creation is not supported at all.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CreateServiceInstanceAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the service.
member.param: CancellationToken used to cancel the creation operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task that provides the new service instance.

remarks.para:
This method is guaranteed to be called from the UI thread, and only on providers that return 'true' from
if a ConnectedServiceAuthenticator is implemented.

If an implementation desires to present blocking/modal UI, it may do so. If the service instance is created synchronously before the method returns, the returned Task should be marked as completed (likely via Task.FromResult()).

If the implementation runs in the background, it may return an in-progress Task, and the Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the Task completes. In this case, the Connected Services code may cancel the task via the CancellationToken if the user closes the Conencted Services UI before the instance has been created.

If the implementation does not or cannot monitor the creation of the new instance, it may return null. In this case, the Connected Services code will do nothing, and requires the user to manually refresh/enumerate the service instances to check for the newly- created instance.

If the implementation shows/handles any errors, the Task should not fault on them, nor throw them as Exceptions. If the returned Task completes in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CanConfigureServiceInstance
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether instances of this service can be configured through the connected service provider.

remarks.para: Not all connected service providers will allow configuration of instances (or not without authentication, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ConfigureServiceInstanceText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use as the text of the control for the users to configure an instance.

remarks.para: Not all connected service providers will allow configuration. Providers may return null if configuration is not supported.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ConfigureServiceInstanceAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstance,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Configure a service instance either through a dialog or linking to the configure web page.
member.param: The service instance to configure.
CancellationToken used to cancel the configuration operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task for the configuration. The Task's result value indicates whether any changes were made to the instance.

remarks.para:
This method is guaranteed to be called from the UI thread, and only on providers that return 'true' from
if a ConnectedServiceAuthenticator is implemented.

If an implementation desires to present blocking/modal UI, it may do so. If the service instance is configured synchronously before the method returns, the returned Task should be marked as completed (for example, via Task.FromResult()).

If the implementation runs in the background, it may return an in-progress Task, and the Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the Task completes. In this case, the Connected Services code may cancel the task via the CancellationToken if the user closes the Conencted Services UI before the instance has been created.

If the implementation does not or cannot monitor the configuration of the instance, it may return null. In this case, the Connected Services code will do nothing, and requires the user to manually refresh/enumerate the service instances to check for changes to the configured instance.

If the implementation shows/handles any errors, the Task should not fault on them, nor throw them as Exceptions. If the returned Task completes in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandler
member.summary: A MEF contract implemented by Connected Service authors in order to add a service instance reference to the project, including adding files, SDKs, and snippets.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandler.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandler.AddServiceInstanceAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Given a connected service instance, add the necessary files and SDKs to the project in order to enable the given service.
member.param: The handler context containing information such as the ConnectedServiceInstance that should be added to the project, the project that it should be added to, and other services.
Cancellation Token to track cancellation.
member.returns: Returns an AddServiceInstanceResult that contains information for the service folder and launching GettingStarted information after AddServiceInstanceAsync has completed.
member.remarks: The context's logger will write any status messages to the caller. This will include warnings and failures that occurred while trying to add a new file, SDK references, or injecting code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandler.UpdateServiceInstanceAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Given an existing connected service instance, update the necessary files and SDKs in the project in order to enable the given service.
member.param: The service instance that should be added to the project, including the project that it should be added to and other information.
Cancellation Token to track cancellation.
member.returns: Returns an UpdateServiceInstanceResult that contains information for launching GettingStarted information after UpdateServiceInstanceAsync has completed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerContext
member.summary: The context information and services given to ConnectedServiceHandler instances during AddServiceInstanceAsync and UpdateServiceInstanceAsync.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are provided by the Connected Services infrastructure. It is not intended that you inherit from this class from your production code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerContext.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor supports unit testing your extension and is not intended to be used directly from your production code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerContext.ServiceInstance
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance of the service to add to the project.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerContext.HandlerHelper
member.summary: Gets or sets a ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper that can be used to perform project configuration tasks such as adding references, manipulating configuration files, and adding files to the project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerContext.CreateEditableXmlConfigHelper
member.summary: Creates an EditableXmlConfigHelper that can be used to read or write xml configuration files.
member.returns: A new EditableXmlConfigHelper object which can be used to read or write xml configuration files.
member.remarks: Xml configuration files are typically app.config or web.config files in the project.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type provides a ConnectedServiceHandler export.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique Provider ID for the provider/handler. This is used to match a provider with its handlers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.ProviderId
member.summary: Gets the unique Provider ID for the provider/handler. This is used to match a provider with its handlers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.AppliesTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the "AppliesTo" query string for matching a connected service handler to a project's capabilities.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.TargetPlatform
member.summary: Gets or sets the "TargetPlatform" string for matching a connected service handler to a project's target platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.TargetPlatformVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the "TargetPlatformVersion" string for matching a connected service handler to a project's target platform version.
member.remarks: The syntax for specifying a version range is the same syntax as used in the .vsixmanifest InstallationTarget Version attribute. For more information, see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee943167.aspx.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.SupportedOutputType
member.summary: Gets or sets the "OutputType" string for matching a connected service handler to a project's target platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.SupportedProjectTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the "ProjectTypes" query string for matching a connected service handler to a project's target platform.
member.remarks: The Guids can be in the following formats: "N": 32 digits: 00000000000000000000000000000000. "D": 32 digits separated by hyphens: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000. You can use the same syntax as the 'AppliesTo' attribute for building a query string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.CustomEvaluator
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a connected service handler contains its own logic to specify if it supports a project. If true, the handler should implement the IVsHierarchyCustomEvaluator interface.
member.remarks: For performance reasons, it is recommended to use the other properties if possible. That way fewer extensions need to be loaded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerExportAttribute.IsAbortSupported
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to support the Abort button in the Progress Dialog. The default is false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper
member.summary: A class that contains helper methods that ConnectedServiceHandler objects commonly use.
member.remarks:
The ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper operates on the same Visual Studio project as the corresponding ConnectedServiceInstanceContext that it was retrieved from.
Instances of this class are provided by the Connected Services infrastructure. It is not intended that you inherit from this class from your production code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor supports unit testing your extension and is not intended to be used directly from your production code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper.TokenReplacementValues
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of token replacement key and values that will be used to replace tokens in AddFileAsync and PerformTokenReplacement.
member.remarks:
The tokens are specified in the file content with the following format: $TokenName$. That is, the token's name with a $ character immediately before and immediately after.
The following list describes the built-in tokens that can be used: 1. ProjectName - The Name of the current VS Project. 2. vslcid - The Locale ID of the current UI culture, for example - 0x1033 for English-US. 3. RootNamespace - The root namespace for the current file being added in AddFileAsync. For C# projects, this value is dynamically calculated based on the DefaultNamespace of the VS project, plus the folder the file is being added to. For VB projects, it is just the DefaultNamespace of the VS project. 4. ProjectDefaultNamespace - The VS Project's "DefaultNamespace" value, as set in Project Properties. 5. AssemblyName - The name of the output assembly of the VS Project. 6. ServiceInstance.Name - The Name of the ConnectedServiceInstance. 7. ServiceInstance.InstanceId - The InstanceId of the ConnectedServiceInstance. 8. For each string value in the ConnectedServiceInstance.Metadata dictionary, a token with the name ServiceInstance.{Metadata Name} will be added with the value of the corresponding Value in the Metadata dictionary.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper.AddAssemblyReference(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a reference to the specified assembly to the project.
member.param: The assembly to which to add a reference. This can be specified either as a simple .NET Framework object name, such as "System.Web", or as a .NET Framework file name, such as "C:\path\program.dll".
member.exception: Thrown when the assembly reference is not successfully added to the project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper.AddFileAsync(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.AddFileOptions)
member.summary: Adds the specified file to the project after doing token replacement using any tokens found in TokenReplacementValues or the dictionary specified in addFileOptions.
member.param: The file to copy and add to the project.
The full or relative path where the file should be added. If specifying a full path, the path must be in a sub-directory of the project's directory.
The options to use while adding the file.
member.returns: Returns the path to the file that was added.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper.GetServiceArtifactsRootFolder
member.summary: Gets the name of the root folder to place the service related artifacts in. Typcially each provider will create its own subfolder under this root folder.
member.returns: The name of the root folder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandlerHelper.PerformTokenReplacement(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Given an input, replace any tokens found in TokenReplacementValues or the specified dictionary with the specified values.
member.param: The text to update.

A dictionary of key/value pairs that will be used to replace tokens in the input. These values are additional to the values in TokenReplacementValues. In the case of conflicts, the values specified in additionalReplacementValues will override the TokenReplacementValues.
member.returns: Returns a new string with the tokens replaced.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInfo
member.summary: Provides information about a connected service that has been configured in a Visual Studio project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.Version,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.IVsHierarchyItem)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The version of the provider that was used to configure this service.
An IVsHierarchyItem that represents the folder that contains the ConnectedService.json file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInfo.ProviderId

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInfo.Version

member.remarks: This can be null if the Version isn't specified in the ConnectedService.json file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInfo.ServiceFolder
member.summary: Gets an IVsHierarchyItem that represents the folder that contains the ConnectedService.json file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstance.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique ID for the service instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstance.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the human readable display name of the service instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstance.Metadata
member.summary: Gets metadata for the service instance used by the service provider and the service consumer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory
member.summary: The severity level of a message logged by ILogger.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory.Information
member.summary: The message can be shown to the user and is just for information. It is shown in the Output window and in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory.Debug
member.summary: The message is only to be used to help debug the application. It is shown only in the Output window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory.Warning
member.summary: Something non-critical went wrong or the user should be aware of a possible issue, but the operation can continue. It is shown in the Output window and in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory.Error
member.summary: Something went wrong and the operation can not continue. It is shown in the Output window and in the progress dialog.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceLogger

The message to write.

A composite format string
An object array that contains zero or more objects to format.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the organization or person that created this ConnectedServiceProvider.

member.summary: Gets or sets the version number of this ConnectedServiceProvider.

member.summary: Gets or sets a link to MSDN, Azure Portal, sign-up page, etc. if the name and description are not enough for the user to understand.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the provider has modal or modeless UI

member.summary: Sets or sets the Metadata for this data object

member.summary: Creates the view model object used for displaying the service configuration dialog.

member.returns: A ConnectedServiceConfigurator object that will be used as the view model in the service configuration dialog.
member.remarks: The Connected Services core will call Dispose() on this instance when the dialog is closed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProvider.GetSupportedTechnologyLinks
member.summary: Gets a list of hyperlinks to display on the right side of the Connected Services "Selection" dialog under "Supported technologies".
member.returns: An IEnumerable of Tuple instances. The string is the text that gets displayed in the UI and the Uri is the location that is opened when the hyperlink is executed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProviderContext
member.summary: The context information and services given to ConnectedServiceProvider instances during CreateConfiguratorAsync.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are provided by the Connected Services infrastructure. It is not intended that you inherit from this class from your production code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProviderContext.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor supports unit testing your extension and is not intended to be used directly from your production code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProviderContext.GetServiceFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the IVsHierarchyItem for the Connected Service folder with the specified name, or null if the specified folder isn't valid.
member.param: The name of the folder that contains the ConnectedService.json file. This is a folder under the "Service Artifacts Root Folder" - i.e. "Service References" for .Net projects or "services" for JavaScript projects.
member.returns: An IVsHierarchyItem that represents the folder that contains the ConnectedService.json file. Null is returned if the folder doesn't exist, doesn't contain a ConnectedService.json file, or the ProviderId doesn't match the current Provider's Id.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProviderContext.InitializeUpdateContext(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.IVsHierarchyItem)
member.summary: InitializeUpdateContext puts the current connected service session in update mode. This allows providers to update a connected service that already exists in the project.
member.param: The IVsHierarchyItem that represents the folder that contains the ConnectedService.json file. This is a folder under the "Service Artifacts Root Folder" - i.e. "Service References" for .Net projects or "services" for JavaScript projects.
member.exception: The specified folder isn't a valid connected service folder. It doesn't have a valid ConnectedService.json file with a matching ProviderId.
GetExtendedDesignerData or SetExtendedDesignerData has already been called on this context.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProviderContext.StartBusyIndicator(System.String)
member.summary: Shows a busy indicator and message to the user to indicate that Visual Studio is actively working on processing the current request.
member.param: An optional message to show to the user.
member.returns: An IDisposable object that will stop the busy indicator when it is disposed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProviderExportAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type provides a ConnectedServiceProvider export.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique Provider ID for the provider/handler. This is used to match a provider with its handlers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProviderExportAttribute.ProviderId
member.summary: Gets the unique Provider ID for the provider/handler. This is used to match a provider with its handlers.
member.remarks: The recommended Provider ID format is: [Service Company].[Service].[SubService]

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceProviderExportAttribute.SupportsUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the is capable of updating an existing connected service.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage
member.summary: A ConnectedServiceConfigurator that shows completely custom UI in a single step.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the page that is shown at the top of the dialog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the page that is shown at the top of the dialog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.IsFinishEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ConnectedServiceSinglePage.GetFinishedServiceInstanceAsync() can be invoked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.View
member.summary: Gets or sets the WPF UI Element that describes the content of the page.
member.remarks: The default/minimum space available for this view is 754px (w) X 367px (h).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.DisableScrollBars
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the default scroll bar functionality for the page should be disabled.
member.remarks:
The default scroll bar functionality is to automatically add a vertical scroll bar if the vertical content is too large to fit in the available vertical space.
If the default scroll bar functionality is disabled, the desired scroll bar functionality must be handled within the provider's View control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.GetFinishedServiceInstanceAsync
member.summary: The method that is invoked when the user gestures that they are finished configuring the service and want their project updated. This method will return a finished service instance that will be passed off to the Handler.
member.returns: A Task that returns the completed ConnectedServiceInstance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.CreateAuthenticatorAsync
member.summary: Creates the ConnectedServiceAuthenticator that allows users to log into the service.
member.returns: A Task that returns the ConnectedServiceAuthenticator instance, or null if the provider doesn't need to use authentication.
member.remarks:
The Connected Services core will call Dispose() on this instance when the dialog is closed.
The Connected Services core only uses the View property on the ConnectedServiceAuthenticator when using the ConnectedServiceSinglePage option. However, the other members may be helpful in your single page implementation. For example, the AuthenticationChanged and IsAuthenticated members inform your ConnectedServiceSinglePage class when the user logs in and out, or switches to a different account.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.OnPageLeavingAsync
member.summary: OnPageLeavingAsync is called on a ConnectedServiceSinglePage when the user is navigating away from the page. This occurs before ConnectedServiceSinglePage.GetFinishedServiceInstanceAsync() is invoked and allows the dialog to perform extra validation before navigating away from the page.
member.returns: A PageNavigationResult that describes the success/failure state of the navigation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServicesManager
member.summary: A MEF contract implemented by the Connected Services to expose externally callable Connected Services functionality.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are provided by the Connected Services infrastructure. It is not intended that you inherit from this class from your production code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServicesManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor supports unit testing your extension and is not intended to be used directly from your production code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServicesManager.ShowConnectedServicesManager(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy)
member.summary: Shows the Connected Services dialog as a modal popup.
member.param: The project to which to add the connected service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServicesManager.CanConfigureService(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the specified provider can be configured on the specified project.
member.param: The string identifier of the ConnectedServiceProvider.

The range of provider versions for which to check. The syntax for specifying a version range is the same syntax as used in the .vsixmanifest InstallationTarget Version attribute. For more information, see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee943167.aspx.
The project to which to check if configuring the service is possible.
member.returns: True if a connected service from the specified provider can be configured in the specified project; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: CanConfigureService checks if the specified provider is installed, in the acceptable version ranage, and whether there is an installed handler that supports the specified project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServicesManager.ConfigureServiceAsync(System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy,Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConfigureServiceOptions)
member.summary: Configures a connected service in the specified project using the specified providerId.
member.param: The string identifier of the ConnectedServiceProvider.
The project to which to configure the service.
The options to use while configuring the service.
member.returns: A Task that will signal when this action is complete.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServicesManager.GetConfiguredServices(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy)
member.summary: Gets the connected services that have been configured in the specified project.
member.param: The project for which to get all the configured services.
member.returns: A collection of ConnectedServiceInfo objects that represent each service that has been configured in the project.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.EditableXmlConfigHelper
member.summary:
Provides methods for editing configuration settings in the user's project.
The Save method must be called to save any changes.

This class does not preserve whitespace in the appSettings section.
Instances of this class are provided by the Connected Services infrastructure. It is not intended that you inherit from this class from your production code.

member.summary: Method called when the selected account has changed
member.param: The currently selected account
The subscriptions associated with the account
The currently active view when the selected account was changed
A cancellation token to signal cancellation of the operation
member.returns: A task that completes when the event has been handled. If the task is faulted, the exception will be recorded in the VS activity log.
member.remarks: This method will be called on the UI thread.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.XmlConfigHelper
member.summary: Provides methods for reading configuration settings in the user's project.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are provided by the Connected Services infrastructure. It is not intended that you inherit from this class from your production code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.XmlConfigHelper.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor supports unit testing your extension and is not intended to be used directly from your production code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.XmlConfigHelper.Configuration
member.summary: Gets the Configuration object that can be used to inspect the configuration settings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.XmlConfigHelper.GetAppSetting(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the string value of the setting with the specified key in the appSettings config section with the specified key and value.
member.param: The key of the app setting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.XmlConfigHelper.IsPrefixUsedInAppSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an appSetting key exists with the specified keyPrefix.
member.param: The prefix string to check for.
member.returns: true if an appSetting already exists that has a key starting with the keyPrefix; otherwise, false.
